Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp

Class OtpModule

java.lang.Object
com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.OtpModule
public class OtpModule extends Object
OtpModule class which is the entry-point for OTP features.

4.0

    • reset

      @Deprecated public boolean reset() throws IdpException
      Deprecated.
      Cleanup the data associated with OTP module. Tokens that have been provisioned before will be removed.
      Returns:
      true if rest is successful.
      Throws:
      IdpException - when database operation failed.
      Since:
      4.9.0
      See Also:
      • IdpCore.reset()
      • IdpCore.resetSDK(ResetModule)

    • updateDeviceFingerprintTokenPolicy

      public void updateDeviceFingerprintTokenPolicy(@NonNull String tokenName, @Nullable byte[] oldCustomFingerprintData, @NonNull DeviceFingerprintTokenPolicy newTokenFingerprintPolicy) throws IdpException
      To apply the new device fingerprint policy to the token. This API will change (add or remove) the token policy properties such as:
      • The mode failIfInvalid (refer to DeviceFingerprintTokenPolicy(boolean, DeviceFingerprintSource))
      • The custom fingerprint data (refer to DeviceFingerprintSource(byte[], DeviceFingerprintSource.Type...)).

        NOTE: The application manages the custom fingerprint data value so that it uses the proper value while retrieving the token, for example, by calling CapTokenManager.getToken(String, byte[])

      • The fingerprint source type (refer to DeviceFingerprintSource.Type)

      NOTE: The application has to retrieve the token object again to update the changes, for example, by calling CapTokenManager.getToken(String) or CapTokenManager.getToken(String, byte[])

      Parameters:
      tokenName - The token name.
      oldCustomFingerprintData - The old custom fingerprint data (if any).
      newTokenFingerprintPolicy - The new token device fingerprint policy.
      Throws:
      IdpException - If the update fails. The possible errors are as follows:
      • IdpStorageException: Failed to retrieve the token information from internal database.
      • PasswordManagerException: The user has not logged in to PasswordManager.
      • DeviceFingerprintException: The provided oldCustomFingerprintData does not match with the one in token. Especially, the code IdpResultCode.FINGERPRINT_UPDATE_FAILED_IDENTICAL_POLICY will be thrown if the old and new policy are identical.
      • IdpException: A generic error. Check the code or message for more details.
      Since:
      5.4
      See Also:
      • CapTokenManager.getToken(String)
      • CapTokenManager.getToken(String, byte[])
      • OathTokenManager.getToken(String)
      • OathTokenManager.getToken(String, byte[])
